Notes: "Caused selective pressure on the vocal tract and other systems involved in speech production and processing."
"It therefore seems plausible that vocalizations have played a role in language from the beginning."
"Indicate that speech and language most likely evolved together, and that we can therefore assume that the beginnings of language are at least 400,000 years old as well."
"Could complex vocalization have evolved for something other than language e.g., for singing"
"Could language have (initially) evolved without complex vocalizations e.g., through a gestural origin."

"Given that even with a monkey-like vocal tract it is probably already possible to produce a range of articulations that is sufficient to be usable for language, it seems that cognitive adaptations must have triggered the emergence of language ."
